//: SEO: Tooling keeps code style consistent, preventing issues that harm search engine crawlability.
Accessibility: Linting enforces semantic HTML and ARIA patterns flagged by recommended configs.
Performance: Formatter and linters ensure minimal bundle size by avoiding stray assets and whitespace.
Safety: Dependencies are pinned to exact versions to avoid supply-chain surprises.

scripts.lint:html: echo 'Skipping HTML lint - Jekyll templates require build first'
scripts.start: npm run build && npm run serve
scripts.dev: npm run build:css && npm run jekyll -- build && http-server _site -p 4000 -c-1
scripts.dev:watch: concurrently "npm run watch:css" "npm run jekyll -- build --watch" "http-server _site -p 4000 -c-1"
scripts.build: npm run build:css && npm run jekyll -- build
scripts.build:full: npm run build:css && npm run build:logos && npm run jekyll -- build
scripts.fix:all: npm run fix:phase1 && npm run fix:phase2 && npm run fix:phase3 && npm run fix:phase4 && npm run lint:css && npm run lint:css:fix && npm run lint:css
